page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: The land round Colinsburgh is very fertile and consequently intensively farmed. The two farmers on our grid are tenant farmers working land belonging to Balcarres and Charleton Estates. It is very much a mixed farming area. Wheat and barley are the main grain crops while potatoes and turnips the chief root crops. Because of the demand for frozen vegetables peas and sprouts are now grown on a commercial scale. A few hundred sheep are kept and beef cattle reared. They are sold at Cupar auction market. Potato harvesting -"The Tatties"-is a favourite autumn ploy with the children. Tractors and combines are frequently seen in the village street.
